text:
ac
count. Explain what the CTG does and what your findings are.
• The CTG should never be interpreted in isolation from the patient.
o Do not make any decision about a woman’s care in labour based on cardiotocography findings alone
- take into account any antenatal and intrapartum risk factors, the current wellbeing of the woman and
unbor
n baby and, intrapartum, the progress of labour.
o The CTG is never a substitute for good clinical observation and judgement.
• Ensure that the focus of care
